alert.note: Alert for Cumberland (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 06 at 7:40PM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Cumberland County through 830 PM CDT... At 740 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles south of Crossville, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Crossville, Fairfield Glade, Crab Orchard, Lake Tansi and Cumberland Mountain State Park. This includes Interstate 40 between mile markers 324 and 339. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
